cardCount0.css: background: #a1bdff80; color: black;font-size:24px; border:1px solid lightgrey;display: flex;justify-content: center;align-items: center;

cardCount-a0.css: background: white; color: black;font-size:24px; border:1px solid lightgrey;display: flex;justify-content: center;align-items: center;

cardCount-b0.css: background: white; color: black;font-size:24px; border:1px solid lightgrey;display: flex;justify-content: center;align-items: center;

autoplayPreselectedCardsRoutine.Note: this automatically plays the preselected cards of the player whose turn it is, if they have any and have confirmed their selection, unless they are the lead player of a one round game. Or if they have passed from the round or the hand then play passes on to the next player who is still in.

fields.text: Are you creating a game in this room?

fields.label: -- Check to enable multi-card melds. -- Uncheck if cards should played singly.
-- Check if this a game where a player may pass and then later come back into the trick. -- Uncheck if there is no passing, or players who pass cannot re-enter play until the next trick.
-- Check if this a game where play stops after all have played one card/meld (e.g. standard trick taker). -- Uncheck if play continues until all but one have passed (e.g. standard climbing game).
-- Check if cards should be played into a common play area. -- Uncheck if they should be played to personal play areas.

-- Check if all previously played cards in other personal play areas should be cleared each time a card or meld is played. -- Uncheck if the cards in the play areas should stay until manually cleared. (this only takes effect if cards should be played to personal play areas)

-- Check if cards should be added to any existing cards in the play area (although they may be manually cleared away first). -- Uncheck if the cards in the play area should be automaticly cleared away each time a meld is played.

-- Check if cards should be played on top of the existing cards in the play area (with the last meld peeking out from underneath). -- Uncheck if the cards should be played next to the cards already in the play area. (this only takes effect if cards should be added to the existing cards in the play area)
-- Check if cards should be gathered into a personal holder at when cleared. -- Uncheck if they should be cleared to the deck holder.
Primary sort key to use when sorting hands (leave empty for none)
Secondary sort key to use when sorting hands (leave empty for none)
Deck to use for ${key} players (leave empty for unsupported payercounts)
Number of cards to deal each player for ${key} players (leave at 0 for unsupported payercounts)

fields.text: You will go out. Are you sure?
This will reset the game. Are you sure?
This will delete the existing grid and reset this widget. Are you sure?

loopRoutine.note: This was added by the automatic file migration because the behavior of MOVE with count=0 changed.

The following graphics are from https://game-icons.net and are used under CC BY 3.0: * Poker Hand: https://game-icons.net/1x1/lorc/poker-hand.html * Round Star: https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/round-star.html * Hearts: https://game-icons.net/1x1/skoll/hearts.html * Diamonds: https://game-icons.net/1x1/skoll/diamonds.html * Spades: https://game-icons.net/1x1/skoll/spades.html * Clubs: https://game-icons.net/1x1/skoll/clubs.html  

Library image generated using the MyNinja artificial intelligence image generator, https://myninja.ai/, using the following prompt: "evasion from Chinese jail, happy prisoners holding 27 cards guan dan, funny cartoon"
info.description: An intense and popular climbing game where two teams of 3 players tries to sneak their way out first!
info.ruleText:
Refer to the player aid available in the room. This implementation uses a modernized ruleset from the TV feature "Chess and Card Game" ("å¼ˆæ£‹è€å¤§ç‰Œ").

Find players on : Online Card Players (https://discord.gg/wXdPDFgQtS), Guan Dan (https://discord.gg/B2hRAt5DNv)
info.helpText:
SETUP Players take seats, then click on the Deal Button (clickable area between the Red/Blue score counter). First player is randomized, then will automatically rotate on each new deal.

HOW TO PLAY CARDS On your turn: - Select cards from your hand and click PLAY to play cards from your hand to the table. Cards can be choosen by clicking on them or by using the blue circle selector - Click PASS to pass turn to next player FUNCTION BUTTONS Click on those (personal) buttons for: - UNSELECT ALL: cancel cards selection - AID: see a rules summary - SORT: sort cards by rank - TURN: move active player around the table (for changing round starter, or passing lead to a partner) - CLEAN: delete your played cards when you've gone out - + - : update team score Those steps are NOT automated : - Tribute / Card exchange - Meld cleaning when going out - Scoring
